actor_awards.notes: Best known for his role as Ed Norton in the sitcom 'The Honeymooners'. He won the Academy Award for Best Actor for his performance in 'Harry and Tonto' (1974) and won six Primetime Emmy Awards throughout his career.

filmography.title: Harry and Tonto
filmography.role_description: An elderly widower who is evicted from his apartment and embarks on a cross-country journey with his pet cat, Tonto.
filmography.plot: When his apartment building is torn down, a retired teacher travels across the United States with his beloved cat, encountering various characters and reconnecting with his children.

filmography.title: The Late Show
filmography.role_description: An aging, ailment-ridden private investigator who reluctantly takes on a new case to help a quirky woman.
filmography.plot: An aging private eye tries to solve the murder of his partner while dealing with a kooky female client who wants him to find her missing cat.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Win – Best Actor

filmography.title: Going in Style
filmography.role_description: One of three elderly retirees who, bored with their lives, decide to rob a bank.
filmography.plot: Three bored senior citizens living in Queens decide to rob a bank to put some excitement back into their lives.

filmography.title: The Muppets Take Manhattan
filmography.role_description: A well-meaning theatrical producer who tries to help the Muppets get their show on Broadway.
filmography.plot: Kermit and his friends go to New York to get their musical on Broadway only to find it's a more difficult task than they anticipated.

filmography.title: Firestarter
filmography.role_description: A kind farmer who shelters a father and his pyrokinetic daughter from government agents.
filmography.plot: A couple who participated in a potent medical experiment gain telepathic ability and then have a child who is pyrokinetic.

filmography.title: Last Action Hero
filmography.role_description: The second cousin of the protagonist's favorite movie theater projectionist; Carney's final film role.
filmography.plot: With the help of a magic ticket, a young film fan is transported into the fictional world of his favorite action movie character.

filmography.title: W.W. and the Dixie Dancekings
filmography.role_description: A lawman and preacher pursuing a con artist who is managing a country music band.
filmography.plot: A con man takes over a country-western band and tries to lead them to fame while evading a tenacious lawman.

filmography.title: House Calls
filmography.role_description: The senile chief of surgery at a hospital where a widowed doctor works.
filmography.plot: A man who has recently lost his wife tries to date again, but finds the dating scene very different from what he remembers.

filmography.title: Sunburn
filmography.role_description: An insurance investigator who hires a model to pose as his wife while investigating a claim in Acapulco.
filmography.plot: An insurance investigator hires a model to pose as his wife to help him solve a case in Mexico involving a suspicious car accident.

filmography.title: Movie Movie
filmography.role_description: Carney plays two different doctor roles in this double-feature spoof of 1930s cinema.
filmography.plot: A double feature of 1930s-style movies: a boxing picture and a Busby Berkeley-style musical.

filmography.title: St. Helens
filmography.role_description: The real-life lodge owner who famously refused to evacuate his home on the slopes of Mount St. Helens before the eruption.
filmography.plot: A dramatization of the events leading up to the 1980 eruption of Mount St. Helens.

filmography.title: Roadie
filmography.role_description: The eccentric father of the main character, an inventor who creates strange gadgets.
filmography.plot: A truck driver with a knack for fixing things becomes a roadie for a traveling rock and roll show.

filmography.title: Steel
filmography.role_description: An old-time steelworker recruited to help complete a skyscraper on a tight deadline.
filmography.plot: A construction crew battles time, the elements, and sabotage to finish a high-rise building on schedule.

filmography.title: Defiance
filmography.role_description: A local resident who befriends a merchant seaman taking a stand against a neighborhood gang.
filmography.plot: A merchant seaman takes temporary residence in a neighborhood overrun by a violent gang and decides to fight back.

filmography.title: The Yellow Rolls-Royce
filmography.role_description: A loud American gangster touring Italy who buys the titular car for his girlfriend.
filmography.plot: Three stories about the lives and loves of those who own a certain yellow Rolls-Royce.

filmography.title: A Guide for the Married Man
filmography.role_description: A cameo appearance as a technical adviser in a vignette about infidelity.
filmography.plot: A man who loves his wife but is bored with his marriage receives lessons on how to have an affair from his best friend.

filmography.title: Won Ton Ton: The Dog Who Saved Hollywood
filmography.role_description: A studio executive in this comedy about Old Hollywood.
filmography.plot: A dog becomes a major movie star in the 1920s, but his human friends struggle with the studio system.

filmography.title: Pot o' Gold
filmography.role_description: An early role as a member of Horace Heidt's band and a radio announcer.
filmography.plot: A music-loving owner of a failed music shop ends up on a popular radio show.

filmography.title: The Naked Face
filmography.role_description: An eccentric private investigator hired by a psychiatrist to find out who is trying to kill him.
filmography.plot: A psychiatrist becomes a target for murder and must uncover the identity of his assailant before it's too late.

filmography.title: Take This Job and Shove It
filmography.role_description: The owner of a local bar where the brewery workers congregate.
filmography.plot: A corporate conglomerate buys a local brewery and the new manager must decide between his career and his old friends.

filmography.title: Better Late Than Never
filmography.role_description: A senior citizen who rebels against the strict rules of a retirement home. (TV Movie)
filmography.plot: Residents of a retirement home revolt against the strict rules imposed by the administration.

filmography.title: Izzy and Moe
filmography.role_description: A prohibition agent who teams up with his partner Izzy Einstein (Jackie Gleason) to catch bootleggers. (TV Movie)
filmography.plot: Two vaudeville performers become successful Prohibition agents by using disguises to raid speakeasies.

filmography.title: Terrible Joe Moran
filmography.role_description: The loyal friend and former cornerman to an aging ex-boxer played by James Cagney. (TV Movie)
filmography.plot: An aging former boxing champ reconnects with his estranged granddaughter who wants to write his biography.
filmography.awards: Primetime Emmy: Win – Outstanding Supporting Actor in a Limited Series or a Special

filmography.title: Scott Joplin
filmography.role_description: The music publisher who discovers and promotes the ragtime composer Scott Joplin.
filmography.plot: A biography of the African-American composer and pianist Scott Joplin, known as the King of Ragtime.

filmography.title: Ravagers
filmography.role_description: A survivalist living in a post-apocalyptic world who helps the protagonist.
filmography.plot: In a post-apocalyptic world, a man searches for a legendary lush valley where he can live in peace.
